document_title: TUH INC-ADMIN-MM-GUIDELINES-36-Empiric Antimicrobial Recommendations for Common Infections in Hospitalized Adults - Dosing Tables
caveat: This document is intended as a guideline only & should NOT replace sound clinical judgement.

calculation_notes.CrCl_formula: [(140-age) x weight*] / [72 x SCr] (x0.85 if female)
calculation_notes.weight_use: *weight: Use IBW unless a) TBW<IBW → use TBW or b) TBW is >120%IBW → use AdjBW. eGFR is typically NOT recommended for drug dosing unless noted otherwise.
calculation_notes.CVVHDF_note: Literature on dosing for CVVHDF is limited. Consider the severity/site of infection and the toxicity profile of the drug to determine dosing, and consider TDM (therapeutic drug monitoring) if available.

renal_dosing_table.drug: Acyclovir IV (HSV encephalitis/meningitis or Varicella or Herpes Zoster infection, If BMI ≥35 kg/m² use AdjBW)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: 1.5g q12h AD or 1.5-3g q24h or 3g q24h AD

renal_dosing_table.drug: Ampicillin/Sulbactam IV (High dose regimen for Carbapenem resistant Acinetobacter spp. infections: 9 gram over 4 hours)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_gt_50: 9g q8h over 4 hours (CrCl 50-60 is a gray zone. Can be dosed as >60 or 30-60.)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: CrCl <30 (6g q8h over 4 hours - no data)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_gt_50: 3-day regimen: 500mg q24h. 5-day regimen: 500mg q24h x 1day, then 250mg q24h x 4 days

renal_dosing_table.drug: Aztreonam IV (Mild to moderate systemic infections/UTI - Standard dose: 1 gram)
Aztreonam IV (Serious systemic gram-negative infections including Pseudomonas aeruginosa - Standard dose: 2 gram)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: 2g q24h AD or 2g q24h or 1g q12h AD or 1g q12h

renal_dosing_table.hd: 1g q24h AD or 2g after each HD (Can give 3g AD if next HD to occur in 3 days)

renal_dosing_table.drug: Cefepime IV (Standard dose: 2 gram over 30 minutes)
renal_dosing_table.hd: 2g loading dose, followed by: 1g q24h AD or 2g after each HD

renal_dosing_table.drug: Cefepime IV (Neutropenic fever, CNS infections - Standard dose: 2 gram over 30 minutes)
renal_dosing_table.hd: 2g loading dose, followed by: 1g q24h AD or 2g after each HD

renal_dosing_table.drug: Cefepime IV (Intensive pharmacodynamically optimized dosing - 2g loading dose over 30 min, then infused over 4 hours)
renal_dosing_table.hd: 1g q24h AD or 2g after each HD over 4 hrs

renal_dosing_table.drug: Ceftriaxone IV (Meningitis, Enterococcal infective endocarditis - Standard dose: 2 gram)
Cephalexin PO (Uncomplicated Urinary Tract Infections - Standard dose: 500 mg)
Ciprofloxacin IV (Uncomplicated Urinary Tract Infections - Standard dose: 200 mg)
Ciprofloxacin IV (Severe systemic infection including Pseudomonas aeruginosa - Standard dose: 400 mg)
Ciprofloxacin PO (Uncomplicated Urinary Tract Infections - Standard dose: 250 mg)
Ciprofloxacin PO (Severe systemic infection including Pseudomonas aeruginosa - Standard dose: 750 mg)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.cvvhdf: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.cvvhdf: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.cvvhdf: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)

renal_dosing_table.drug: Daptomycin IV (Skin and soft tissue infection, simple cystitis - 4 mg/kg. If BMI ≥35 kg/m² use AdjBW)
renal_dosing_table.hd: 4 mg/kg q48h AD or 4 mg/kg after each HD
6 mg/kg q48h AD or 6 mg/kg after each HD (Can give 9mg/kg AD if next HD to occur in 3 days)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.hd: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)
renal_dosing_table.cvvhdf: NO RENAL DOSAGE ADJUSTMENT NECESSARY (Not dialyzed)

renal_dosing_table.drug: Fosfomycin PO (Uncomplicated cystitis - 3 gram PO. >3 doses requires ID approval)
Fosfomycin PO (Complicated cystitis - 3 gram PO. Off-label)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: 750mg x1, then 500mg q48h AD or 250mg q24h
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: CrCl <20, on HD (750mg x1, then 500mg q48h AD or 250mg q24h)
renal_dosing_table.hd: CrCl <20, on HD (750mg x1, then 500mg q48h AD or 250mg q24h)

renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: CrCl <20, on HD (500mg x1, then 250mg q48h AD)
renal_dosing_table.hd: CrCl <20, on HD (500mg x1, then 250mg q48h AD)

renal_dosing_table.drug: Meropenem IV (Meningitis, Treatment of Gram-negative organisms with meropenem mic=2 - Standard dose: 2 gram)
Metronidazole IV/PO (General anaerobic coverage: 500 mg IV/PO)
Metronidazole IV/PO (C. difficile, H. pylori, CNS infections, Amebiasis: 500 mg IV/PO)

renal_dosing_table.cvvhdf: CRRT data is limited and conflicting. Weigh risks and benefits.

renal_dosing_table.drug: Piperacillin/tazobactam IV (Extended infusion - Loading dose: 4.5gm over 30min x1)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_gt_50: CrCl ≥220: 3.375g q8h, infuse over 4 hours (CrCl 50-220 is a gray zone. Use clinical judgement.)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: CrCl 50-220: 3.375g q8h, infuse over 4 hours (CrCl 50-220 is a gray zone. Use clinical judgement.)

renal_dosing_table.drug: Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole (TMP/SMX) IV (PCP treatment - Dose based on TMP component)
renal_dosing_table.ed_once_dose: Calculate daily dose & divide by 2-4 (max 500mg TMP)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_gt_50: 15-20mg/kg/DAY divided q6-8h x 48h, then 7-10mg/kg/day divided q12-24h

renal_dosing_table.drug: Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole (TMP/SMX) IV (Other indications - Dose based on TMP component)
renal_dosing_table.ed_once_dose: If renal function unknown, give 5mg/kg (max 500mg TMP)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: CrCl 30-15: 8-12mg/kg/DAY divided q12h x 48h, then 4-6mg/kg/day divided q12-24h
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: CrCl 30-15: 8-12mg/kg/DAY divided q12h x 48h, then 4-6mg/kg/day divided q12-24h
renal_dosing_table.hd: 4-6mg/kg after each HD or 2.5mg/kg q24h AD

renal_dosing_table.drug: Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole (TMP/SMX) PO (Urinary Tract Infection, AECOPD, SSTI - Standard dose: 1 DS PO)
renal_dosing_table.crcl_gt_50: TBW ≤90 kg: 1 DS q12h. TBW >90 kg: 2DS q12h.
renal_dosing_table.crcl_50_30: TBW ≤90 kg: 1 DS q12h. TBW >90 kg: 2DS q12h.
renal_dosing_table.crcl_29_10: CrCl 30-15: 1 SS q12h. CrCl <15: Generally not recommended (1 SS-DS q24h - Limited data).
renal_dosing_table.crcl_lt_10_no_hd: CrCl 30-15: 1 SS q12h. CrCl <15: Generally not recommended (1 SS-DS q24h - Limited data).
